dt: {bc}to go {d_link|aboard|aboard:2} (something, such as a ship, train, airplane, or bus)
{bc}to cover or seal off with a long, thin, and often narrow piece of sawed lumber {bc}to cover or seal off with boards {dx_def}see {dxt|board:1||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}to provide with regular meals and often also lodging usually for compensation

dt.t: supplemented her income by {wi}boarding{/wi} college students

dt: {bc}to check (a player) into the low wooden wall enclosing a hockey rink {bc}to check (a player) into the boards {dx_def}see {dxt|board:1||5}{/dx_def}
{bc}to come up against or alongside (a ship) usually to attack

dt.t: At 12, Danny joined his 16-year-old brother … on the slopes, {wi}boarding{/wi} every day after school.

dt: {bc}to get into or onto a means of transportation (such as an airplane, bus, ship, etc.)

dt.t: A bit late, we hurried to the gate just in time to {wi}board{/wi}.

dt: {bc}to put or allow passengers into or onto such a means of transportation

dt.t: … before my plane {wi}boarded{/wi} I wandered into a duty-free shop to pick up a few last-minute presents.

shortdef: to go aboard (something, such as a ship, train, airplane, or bus)
to cover or seal off with a long, thin, and often narrow piece of sawed lumber : to cover or seal off with boards —usually used with up

dt: {bc}a school that provides meals and lodging

shortdef: a school that provides meals and lodging

dt: {bc}a special piece of paper that one must have in order to be allowed to get onto an airplane

dt.t: Please present your {it}boarding card{/it} to the flight attendant.

shortdef: a special piece of paper that one must have in order to be allowed to get onto an airplane

dt: {bc}a special piece of paper that one must have in order to be allowed to get onto an airplane

dt.t: Please present your {it}boarding pass{/it} to the flight attendant.

shortdef: a special piece of paper that one must have in order to be allowed to get onto an airplane
